decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to create a combo to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes various low-cost spells like Faithful Mending and Prismatic Ending to control the board while setting up the combo. Thoughtseize and Force of Negation are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect the combo. Quantum Riddler and Atraxa, Grand Unifier provide additional value and synergies within the deck. The deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively with its instant reanimation strategy.

The deck aims to utilize the Jeskai Ascendancy combo to quickly generate mana and card advantage while controlling the board with cards like Mishra's Bauble and Portable Hole. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal are key pieces in the deck that help with recurring artifacts and ramping up mana. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card draw and selection, while Urza's Saga can also help tutor for key artifacts. The deck is designed to be fast and versatile, with the ability to win the game quickly once the combo pieces are assembled.

The deck focuses on using cards with cycling to fill the graveyard quickly, then casting Living End to return all creatures from both players' graveyards to the battlefield, essentially resetting the board and giving the player a huge advantage. It also utilizes cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to control the game early on with counterspells and disruption, then go off with Living End to overwhelm the opponent and secure the win.

The key strategy of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By using cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Orim's Chant to limit the opponent's resources and spells, and cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt their game plan, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent until it can establish a dominant position on the battlefield. Additionally, the inclusion of companions like Kaheera, the Orphanguard adds an additional layer of synergy and consistency to the deck's overall game plan.

The primary focus of this Amulet Titan deck is to quickly generate a large mana advantage through utilizing cards like Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and various lands in order to cast powerful spells like Scapeshift to quickly ramp up lands and overwhelm the opponent. The deck revolves around executing a powerful combo that allows for explosive mana generation and efficient creature summoning. By utilizing efficient land tutoring spells and strong land-based abilities, this deck aims to accelerate its game plan and overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and spells.

The deck is focused on utilizing the Broodscale Bloodchief's ability to gain control of opponent's creatures and sacrifice them for value, while also using various combo pieces like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Malevolent Rumble to generate tokens and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes cards like Dredger's Insight and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to draw cards and maintain card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes tools like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Walking Ballista for removal and additional synergy with sacrificing creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using Eldrazi creatures and ramping up mana quickly to cast high-cost spells. It uses cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to accelerate mana production, while also utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Sowing Mycospawn to summon powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Kozilek's Command and Kozilek's Return provide additional control options, while Malevolent Rumble and Ugin's Labyrinth help maintain board presence. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck aims to quickly disrupt the opponent's hand and board state using hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, along with targeted removal like Fatal Push and Bloodchief's Thirst. The deck also utilizes cards like The Rack and Raven's Crime to pressure the opponent's hand size and life total. In addition, it includes cards like Liliana of the Veil and Nihil Spellbomb to disrupt graveyard strategies. The deck can also generate card advantage with cards like Feed the Cycle and has a strong land base with cards like Mishra's Factory and Urza's Saga for additional threats. Overall, this deck aims to be aggressive and disruptive in the early game to quickly close out the match.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp and Overlord of the Balemurk. It also utilizes flicker effects such as Ephemerate to gain value from enter-the-battlefield triggers. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude, while also establishing a strong board presence with creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors efficiently.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures with various abilities using Chord of Calling, while also incorporating a combo with Cauldron Familiar and Viscera Seer to generate value and drain the opponent. The deck includes various mana accelerants and lands that can produce multiple colors of mana to support the varied creature requirements. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtseize and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician provide disruption and additional utility, making the deck adaptable to different matchups and situations.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with Birthing Ritual and utilizing powerful creatures with disruptive abilities like Abhorrent Oculus and Shardless Agent to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes counter spells like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation to protect your creatures and control the board. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on with aggressive creatures while maintaining control and tempo with disruptive spells and abilities.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Lightning Bolt to apply pressure early in the game. It also includes card selection spells like Preordain and Expressive Iteration to dig for the necessary pieces to finish off the opponent. The deck's mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle and maximize the efficiency of its spells. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around fast, efficient aggression to defeat the opponent before they can stabilize.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures such as Solitude and Quantum Riddler. Utilizing flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp for value generation, the deck seeks to control the board and grind out victories with efficient threats like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and versatile creatures like Boggart Trawler adds additional layers of disruption and card advantage to outmaneuver opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and deal damage quickly to your opponent using low-cost spells and creatures. By utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Slickshot Show-Off, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, you aim to quickly diminish your opponent's life total before they can establish their own game plan. Expressive Iteration and Preordain help you dig through your deck for more threats and answers, while Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge provide additional ways to pump up your creatures for maximum damage output.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to maintain control over the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own win condition through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler. By utilizing a variety of spells to control the board and the opponent's resources, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually secure the victory through card advantage and powerful finishers like Solitude.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also incorporates cards that provide additional value, such as Goblin Bombardment and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory adds resilience and power to the deck's threats. Additionally, the deck features cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to maintain pressure on the opponent. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast and efficient threats.
